originalText.text: This school has gotten worse over the years. They keep kicking out all the good teachers or the good teachers leave and replacing them with young teachers who don't really know what they are doing. I had 4 different chemistry teachers in one year, so I as one could expect I didn't learn much. There are maybe 2-3 good teachers left in the high school.

originalText.text: I go to this school (my real name isn’t Hannah Abbot) and it is good. The teachers are overall nice. Staff is nice too, especially with connections. I think people that say that this school is bad are going over the top, even if the experience can be unenjoyable for some.

text.text: I go to this school (my real name isn’t Hannah Abbot) and it is good. The teachers are overall nice. Staff is nice too, especially with connections. I think people that say that this school is bad are going over the top, even if the experience can be unenjoyable for some.

originalText.text: To attend, there is an entrance examination. The school has a very nice atmosphere.  The students seem excited to be there and there are students of many different cultures attending.  If commuting by car/bus, you need to leave a rather large cushion of time as the traffic in the AM is hectic as there are other schools in the vicinity and between the school buses, parents dropping off their kids, construction, accidents, and other unforeseeable things you may need to content with.  There is a library adjacent to the school, and a park that is also close by.  The faculty is professional, and the leadership in the school is great.  Finally, there is an amazing for-profit After school program which provides top notch activities for the kids if you choose to enroll them.

originalText.text: I went to nest+m and it is a great school. The environment, teachers and staff are very friendly. the teacher is always there whenever you need help after school. It is a great school to try out for because it is a gifted and talented school.

text.text: I went to nest+m and it is a great school. The environment, teachers and staff are very friendly. the teacher is always there whenever you need help after school. It is a great school to try out for because it is a gifted and talented school.

originalText.text: This is the first year that our daughter is at nest m, last year, we decided bypassing the bigger high schools for nest. Great teachers, small teacher, student ratio. My daughter is somewhat shy, the teachers has been able to open her up, and has made many new friends. Bottom line, going to a larger highschool can get your child lost in the shuffle, there is a strong possibility that your child will never know their graduating class not at nest. If your child is heading to 9th grade, definitely have them attend the summer program, they can get some courses out of the way, can accustomed to the travel route, and make some friends. Expect about 3-4 hours of homework per day.
